content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a function `extract_julia_code` in Julia that meets the requirements:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    parsed_md = Markdown.parse(md)
    code_blocks = filter(x -> isa(x, Markdown.Code), parsed_md.content)
    julia_code_blocks = filter(x -> "julia" in split(x.language), code_blocks)
    extracted_code = join([x.code for x in julia_code_blocks], "\n")
    return extracted_code
end
```

This function uses the Markdown.jl package to parse the input markdown document. It then filters out the code blocks and only keeps the ones that are Julia code (by checking if "julia" is in the language attribute of the code block). Finally, it joins all the extracted code blocks together with a newline and returns the result as a string.
